review: "Jenny's Moonlight Adventure" didn't quite hit the mark for me. While the Halloween setting and the brave protagonist Jenny are charming, the story felt a bit predictable and lacked the depth and complexity I enjoy in my reads. The plot, centered around a simple mission to return a nose flute, didn't offer the dynamic and visually engaging elements I appreciate, especially in comparison to the intricate and atmospheric narratives I usually favor. The absence of series continuity and familiar characters also detracted from my engagement. While it might be a sweet and earnest read for younger audiences, it didn't resonate with my preferences for more nuanced and detailed storytelling.
